subdefinitions.definition: The physical structure of a human or animal seen as one single organism .
examples: I saw them walking from a distance, their bodies strangely angular in the dawn light.

subdefinitions.definition: The fleshly or corporeal nature of a human, as opposed to the spirit or soul .
examples: The body is driven by desires, but the soul is at peace.
Her body was found at four o’clock, just two hours after the murder.
What’s a body gotta do to get a drink around here?
labels: archaic or informal except in compounds
subdefinitions.label_groups: archaic or informal except in compounds

subdefinitions.definition: A human being , regarded as marginalized or oppressed.

definitions.definition: Main section. ( programming ) The code of a subroutine , contrasted to its signature and parameters . [from 20th c.] ( architecture , of a church ) nave .
examples: In many programming languages, the method body is enclosed in braces.

subdefinitions.definition: The torso , the main structure of a human or animal frame excluding the extremities (limbs, head, tail).
examples: The boxer took a blow to the body .

subdefinitions.definition: The largest or most important part of anything, as distinct from its appendages or accessories .
examples: The bumpers and front tyres were ruined, but the body of the car was in remarkable shape.

subdefinitions.definition: The section of a dress extending from the neck to the waist, excluding the arms.
examples: Penny was in the scullery, pressing the body of her new dress.

subdefinitions.definition: The content of a letter, message, or other printed or electronic document, as distinct from signatures, salutations, headers, and so on.
A group of people having a common purpose or opinion ; a mass .
examples: I was escorted from the building by a body of armed security guards.

subdefinitions.definition: An organisation , company or other authoritative group.
examples: The local train operating company is the managing body for this section of track.

subdefinitions.definition: A unified collection of details , knowledge or information .
examples: We have now amassed a body of evidence which points to one conclusion.

subdefinitions.definition: Any physical object or material thing.
examples: All bodies are held together by internal forces.
We have given body to what was just a vague idea.

subdefinitions.definition: Comparative viscosity , solidity or substance (in wine, colours etc.).
examples: The red wine, sadly, lacked body .

subdefinitions.definition: An agglomeration of some substance, especially one that would be otherwise uncountable.
examples: The English Channel is a body of water lying between Great Britain and France.

definitions.definition: The shank of a type , or the depth of the shank (by which the size is indicated).
examples: a nonpareil face on an agate body

definitions.definition: A three-dimensional object, such as a cube or cone.

secondary_definitions: Main section. ( programming ) The code of a subroutine , contrasted to its signature and parameters . [from 20th c.] ( architecture , of a church ) nave .
( printing ) The shank of a type , or the depth of the shank (by which the size is indicated).
( geometry ) A three-dimensional object, such as a cube or cone.
